HomePage.bio: Hi thereüëã I'm Seongyeol, a developer based in South Korea. I worked as a frontend developer on the renewal project for the <snuLink>website of Seoul National University's Computer Science and Engineering department</snuLink>. I'm now working at <kakaoLink>Kakao</kakaoLink>, a Korean tech company known for services like KakaoTalk, Korea's most widely used messaging app. I also share developer content on <instagramLink>Instagram</instagramLink>.
HomePage.curriculum: Learn CS By Building a Computer
HomePage.curriculumIntro1: This is a series created to share the wonder I felt while learning computer science. Let's follow the process of how small things come together to create a computer!
HomePage.curriculumIntro2: It connects CS knowledge like algorithms, computer architecture, operating systems, and networks into one big picture. I've designed it with interactive examples that you can practice right in your browser, unlike books or videos.
HomePage.curriculumIntro3: Welcome to all developers who've been putting off CS studies, and anyone curious about how computers work üôå
HomePage.react: Become a React Contributor in 2025 (No English translation)

EmailSubscribe.title: Get Notified About New Content üíå
EmailSubscribe.description: I'll keep you posted as the computer takes shape.

Comment.title: I'd Love to Hear Your Thoughts
Comment.description: Feel free to share any questions or thoughts that come to mind while reading this series. For example...
Comment.example1: Things you've always wondered about in computer science, like 'Why does this work this way?'
Comment.example2: Concepts that left a lasting impression while studying computer science
Comment.example3: Concepts that everyone says are important, but you're not quite sure why or how they're used
Comment.encouragement: I believe sharing your questions, experiences, and honest challenges will help other readers. I'll keep working to make this a space where we can learn and grow together :)
